message.content:
cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the anti-ferromagnetic Potts model on families of graphs and establishes a connection between the strong spatial mixing for spin systems and a notion of contraction function. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories, including cs.DS (data structures and algorithms), cs.IT (information theory), cs.CC (computational complexity), cs.SI (social and information networks), and cs.LG (machine learning). However, given the focus on graph properties and their impact on the Potts model, cs.DS and cs.IT seem the most likely categories, followed by cs.CC, cs.SI, and cs.LG.
